Reviews.Title: “Lengthy but worth reading.”
Reviews.Author: Diana D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel due to the low price and beautiful pictures on their website (we were not on a very low budget but noticed that this hotel looked really pretty for the price). The first thing I noticed after checking in was that their room keys were old motel-like keys (believe it or not this has a lot to say about this hotel because a MOTEL is exactly what it ended up being). The walk to our room was amazing (tons of flowers, palm trees, and plants, it almost felt like a secret garden maze). However, once in the room, it set in that this place was like a cheap motel with good landscaping. The room itself was pretty big for two adults and one child and was also pretty clean for the most part. The equipment however (ac unit, shower head, t.v., etc...) were very old. The worst part though was how filthy the carpets were (black feet immediately). Overall it was not a bad room if you need to stay a night or 2 max but any longer than that I would definitely suggest an actual hotel. This place is definitely NOT family friendly. Although no one bothered us during our stay and we got luck enough to have a room away from all of the noise, the vast majority of people who were staying at this location were lower class. Also, their breakfast is ABSOLUTELY NOTHING compared to what their picture shows. I have been on vacation in the midwest part of the United States for about 1 month now and this hotel had the worst breakfast I have encountered during my travels. Please do not stay here especially if you have children. Oh and one more thing. I noticed a review about a year or so ago said that during their stay, this hotel said free internet coming soon so I need to add that their prices are still the same for internet today, such an inconveinience for such a crappy place. I don't know San Diego at all but it seems like this hotel is in a bad part of town. I hope this review helps any one to not make the same mistake we made (we have now switched hotels and are soooo much more comfortable).

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay if your on a budget but...”
Reviews.Author: Claire M
Reviews.Content: With this motel you get what you pay for but I wouldn't suggest it for anyone travelling alone although the entrances are gated and they have a secruity person on duty after 11pm. The customer service both on the phone and at check in needs a lot of improvement. Its a good place to stay for a night or 2 if your on a budget and the rooms were comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, honest housekeeper!”
Reviews.Author: lgutix
Reviews.Content: This property is a great value if you stay in San Diego on a budget. The property grounds are meticulously maintained and the rooms are clean with comfy beds. They have old fashioned keys to each room and the entrances are gated. Staff is accommodating and let us check in at 09:30 instead of the 3:00 normally required d/t an early incoming flight. Some rooms have outdated A/C and heating units but they work. Same goes for the TV. Ours was 19" tube, but mother-in-law had 26" flat screen? All the rooms are non-smoking but there are people smoking everywhere outside and that was irritating by the end of our stay. The hotel has high speed internet but it is wired and available only in rooms for a fee. We were told wireless is coming soon. The free parking and kitchenettes (bring your own pans?) with refrigerators and microwaves and the VERY light free breakfast make this a bargain. Also, when we checked out, we inadvertently left my backpack behind with a laptop, car keys and various electronics (nintendo DS, etc) Hours later, we realized it was missing, called the hotel, and the backpack was at the front desk with nothing missing and even 2 t-shirts we did know we forgot! WOW. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: kentmorrdave
Reviews.Content: Just completed a five night stay at California Suites, a very clean and comfortable room. It had a stove top however, no pots, utensils, etc nor were they promised. It also had a refridgerator. We were in room 1204 with two twin beds, flat screen t.v a/c and I purchased the hi speed internet for $20 for the five nights. A light brealfast is included with outstanding coffee, fresh fruit, cereal, milk, juice and buns. Parking is at a premium but we always found a space. There was a clean pool and a steaming hot jacuzzi which we did not use as the weather was cool. Centrally located and very competively priced.

Reviews.Title: “Would have got better ratings if not for multiple annoyances”
Reviews.Author: Dev R
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right next to I-805 and very convenient for anyone visiting Seaworld or Mission Beach. However, we faced a whole suit of issues from the time we checked in: 1. The rooms initially assigned were singles when we had clearly requested doubles. We had to be reassigned to other rooms and they were not adjacent but one above the other. 2. The beds were old and not firm. I'm not a heavy person and I could feel the bed sagging. My wife found a moth in the middle of the night right next to her head. 3. The first night we stayed, loud neighbors woke us up around 1:00 am. The second night, there was the welcome sound of the police thumping on someone's door at 5:00 am. 4. The breakfast room was closed on the second day since there was some problem with the water supply / wash basin in the kitchen. 5. Parking is inconvenient and a few hundred feet away from the rooms and you have to go through a locked gate. We had to lug our bags around for quite a while before we could find our rooms. The swimming pool and the warm (not hot) tub are nice and the general layout of the hotel is serene and calm too. Other hotels around the Kearny/Mesa area have poorer reviews so not sure if this is the general standard in that area. We would not stay in this hotel again; probably pay more and stay further away from Mission Beach.

Reviews.Title: “better than you pay for”
Reviews.Author: John G
Reviews.Content: It isn't any sort of great hotel, but it is a good value for the prices. It's a bit old and the tenants and neighborhood can feel a bit sketchy. There is usually something or another wrong, like a TV remote or a light or an air conditioner. But I had no major issues in two stays, the clientele has been reasonably quiet and often pleasant, the yogurt place across the street has a very nice yogurt, and overall it is growing on me. Bit noisy in the morning with the maids cleanup. Sometimes noisy at night, especially if your window is open and you don't know it. Rooms clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal for a Clean Room (Just Don't Venture Out)”
Reviews.Author: barstow2needles
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a place to simply lay my head to rest in the Clairemont/Kearny Mesa area in San Diego and made a couple of lodging searches online for an affordable but clean establishment. California Suites was by far the only place in the area that met both criteria. Although there were also some critical comments about unkempt rooms, they only made up a small handful of the reviews. The most common complaint I read in the reviews were about the â€œlong-termâ€� guests who lived in many of the units. Not wasting any time I made the reservation and felt comfortable with my chances. Pulling into the motel, one will notice that it is right off a major street (parking lot back right into the street) and it is surrounded by strip malls, an apartment complex and a gas station/convenient store. The surrounding area is not at all inviting, but was conveniently located and did provide for some good dining options nearby. The establishment itself was presentableâ€”though it looked a little tired, (think late 1960â€™s apartment complex)â€”however the pleasant front desk service put me at ease. Before I got to the room I started thinking about the reviews regarding the â€œlong-termâ€� guests and soon thereafter I started to notice many patrons who fit the mold. As I walked past the pool I did notice a group of young adults in the Jacuzzi conversing loudly while blaring 90s rock music from a radio played in the background (fortunately my room was on the opposite side of the pool). However despite those characters I did not feel threatenedâ€”just a little uncomfortable (as if I was a stranger stepping into someone elseâ€™s home). But of course the real testament is the condition of the room, which I found to be in great condition: extremely clean, spacious and enough toiletries to last me during my stay. It appears that this motel was once an apartment complexâ€”one thing that made me think so is the larger than average kitchenette with many pantries and drawers. The only drawback to the room (though it didnâ€™t matter to me) is the outdate furnishings. Despite all the flaws I still would stay here again for that same price. However if the rate ever goes beyond $75/night I am not so sure it would be worth it. But for now, definitely a good deal for the room you get (just donâ€™t venture out too long)!

Reviews.Title: “A decent,peaceful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ksnarena
Reviews.Content: Rooms were perfect at this California Suites Hotel, first and foremost. The room where i stayed was meticulously clean, the furnishings were plush but simple. There was a convenient business desk. WiFi was free and convenient. Lighting was recessed, throughout, and had dimmer switches! There was a large flat panel, hi-def, TV. There was a refrigerator and microwave in the room which was all I usually need when staying for longer periods of time on business. I slept very well. The payment was made through my business contact, so I cannot comment on price. The check-in clerk was polite, pleasant and expected me by name. He offered breakfast in the morning and, had I not been planning to dine with my business contact, that might also have been a plus. I would recommend this place to anybody with business in California.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice family place”
Reviews.Author: paul r
Reviews.Content: We flew in from NY,(got caught by the Hurricane) the Motel was recommended by our son who checked it out previously. We were coming in for a Wedding and the folks at C/S were the best . Very accomodating people. The rooms are clean and efficient . Ample parking and because it's interior courtyard, The was very little street noise. The Motel is located pretty much in the middle of San Deigo and we found it very convenient to Highways . Just about 15 minutes to anywhere. We certainly would stay there again. Even better that we could have coffe nice and early and only 100 ft away . P&W

Reviews.Title: “Good overall but not without flaws”
Reviews.Author: Shmol
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel is not bad. The pool area and spa were the highlights for us, while the breakfast was very poor. They didn't serve any hot items and the selection of other items like muffins and bagels was also very limited. If you are hoping to have a big breakfast in the morning before you go on to do your things don't book this hotel. The room was rather large, but quite dark and it had a musky type of smell. Luckily we only slept there. Overall, it was clean and the bed was quite comfortable. This hotel is also rather far away from the downtown and other attractions like the zoo. So, if you don't have a car this hotel might not be the right choice for you either.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, great price, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: USCTrojansFan23
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and found it totally adequate. The AC was broken, and the water pressure in the shower was non-existent, but the room was clean and though it is old it was sufficient for what we needed. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to save some $ and planning on not spending a lot of time at your hotel... if you plan to stay at the hotel a lot during your visit to San Diego, you should spend a little more and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: talia82
Reviews.Content: I was with my husband and my two daughters in July at the hotel. It was terrible. One big fraud. There is no connection between what you see in the pictures on the website to the actual reality. We got a small room suite not very old with an old TV with 2 small beds that are not sufficient for 4 people ( we asked to change room but were told that all the rooms are the same. Breakfast was very shameful and very basic with no eggs, no fruits except bananas. In short, do not get close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: vaayla
Reviews.Content: I didn't think the hotel was so bad - we got what we paid for - but my husband hated it. A few things to be aware of if you will be checking in late at night: The cancellation policy says that if you cancel your reservation within 24 hours, you'll be charged for the first night. If you don't arrive until after 9-10pm on the first day of your reservation (or, say, 1am that night, like we did), you will automatically be charged for the first night (on the card you reserved the room with, regardless of what you pay with). Upon your (late night) arrival, you will also pay for the full hotel stay (including the first night again). The fee that was charged to your account for failing to arrive before 9pm will then be refunded, but (depending on your bank) it might not make it back into your account immediately, so if you were counting on that money being in your account, it's something to take into consideration. Also, that late, the parking lot fills up quickly and good luck getting anything larger than a compact into the carport areas. The pros: The landscaping is extremely pretty. Flowers and benches and walkways everywhere. The pool was clean, lighted, and warm. We didn't test out the hot tub, but there were several people in it. There is a microwave, stovetop, and mini-fridge (that was very cold) in the room, as well as two closets (one large and one small), an iron and ironing board, and several shelves in the large closet. We didn't hear any noise at night, but our room was near the stairs (of which there are several; no elevator that I saw), and people were extremely noisy starting around 7:30am. The girl at the night desk was very friendly and efficient, and the woman at check-out was the same. The cons: The hotel room is tiny. We are a family of five and while I expected it to be small, the room was exceedingly cramped. We brought a pot to boil water and it took over half an hour for the water to get up to a boil. That was somewhat annoying. The second night we found that if we started out with hot water, it took about half the time. The air conditioning was pretty ineffectual unless you let it run all day while you were gone, and our first night was unbearable as the room was too hot to sleep and didn't cool down until it was time to get up. The pillows were awful - bring your own (unless you enjoy lumpy bits of disjointed stuffing thrown into a pillow case!). There's no fan in the bathroom (there is a window), so it gets extremely hot and wet in the room while showering. The shower has amazing water pressure - it's really strong - but it nearly takes your face off and there's no way to change that (I listed this as a con because while my husband loved it, it wasn't great for washing the kids). The carpet was disgusting; prepare to wear shoes at all times while in the room or leave gross, black footprints on the bath mat when you go in to take a shower (ew!). And $6.95/night or $19.95/week for wired internet ("wireless internet coming soon!") - not a huge fan. Neutral: As stated in several other reviews (which I read before going), there are long term residents living in the hotel, but other than encountering a few doing their laundry on the way to the pool, we didn't really notice them. There is a continental breakfast that I didn't bother to wake up for. Husband says it was fruit, coffee, toast, and mini-muffins. He brought me back a banana. Other than the carpet, the room was clean but worn; the counters, closets, and bathroom were clean. The bedspread was a bit stained when I pulled it down, so we just took them off completely and used the blankets underneath. The bed was bouncy and not the most comfortable, but not awful (husband hated it, too). You're only given three towels (again, family of five; that was fun), but we didn't try to ask for more, so maybe that would've worked. The tv is tiny, but we were on vacation and didn't spend much time in the room, so that wasn't terribly important to us. There is a locked gate you have to go through to get to the rooms (you're given a key to the room and a key to the gate/pool). The back parking lot is locked until 5am and there appeared to be a security guard patrolling the grounds when we arrived the first night. Overall: I probably would not stay here again. The convenience of having a stovetop and fridge in the room was excellent, but it wasn't worth the headache of cramming so many people into such a small, confined space with inadequate air conditioning and no ventilation. If you need a quick, overnight stop, it's not bad, but I wouldn't try staying with more than two people for an extended period of time.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary, caring service”
Reviews.Author: Interjerry
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed at the California Suites, primarily because of its good reviews, very reasonable prices and proximity to the University of California San Diego Hospital, where my brother had a scheduled and very serious operation. I had to leave after the first night. But in the middle of his stay at California Suites, he was forced to remain at the hospital after negative test indications. He had unfortunately left all his belongings in his hotel room. Teresa, Angela and the hotel staff could not have been more caring and accomodating. They had first given him a requested disabled -friendly room near the entrance. They packed up his things, checked him out, promptly arranged for a full refund of the unused portion of his stay and arranged for his stuff to get to him in the hospital. They went truly above and beyond. This is a fine, clean budget hotel. But the staff is utterly great - day to day - or obviously in an emergency. Thank you, California Suites.

Reviews.Title: “bad experience staying this place never back!”
Reviews.Author: duksoup12345
Reviews.Content: I was there on July stay with my son, bad service, they charge internet $6.95 a day and i was asked for the computer inside lobby, she told me that they will charges if i using that computer, they are so crazy! even early check out they will charges. There will be no refund. Every morning we had to go out to Mc Donald have breakfast because they have terrible breakfast inside room, no waffle no eggs only they have milk, cereal, couple of bagel, old banana. I had bad experience stay this place.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: partsforyou
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently and the stay was horrible. Hotel rooms are not suites but regular rooms. Some rooms have old tvs and some have flat screens. If you have 4 people staying in the room you get 3 sets of towels (makes no sense). You cannot have your stay prorated if you have a set price no matter what the staff tells you. The general manager likes to change his mind to be aware. Let's alk about the breakfast, what breakfast. Toast, bagels, cereal and if your lucky fruit. Property is gated but the gates off the street are never closed and the gates to the hotel are usually left wedged open. Anyone can get access to you or your rooms. Oh but they do have cameras, that is if they really work. The pool and jacuzzi need a real good cleaning not just a spray from the staff and run the hot water. Last but not least the wanna be cops security. The only thing I can say is they need alot of work. The best thing about the stay was leaving. Word to the wise make them put everything in writing.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again Watch out for Bugs”
Reviews.Author: jdean32
Reviews.Content: We came to relax but that never happened the walls were so thin I could hear the person next door snooring. The worst was when I got up in the middle of the night since I could not sleep and saw a cockroach as big as my hand scurry across the floor. I woke my husband up and we tried to find it but could not. Needless to say we checked out the next morning. I would rather spend a few more dollars than have bugs in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: DeeSquared79
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I stayed here on a 3-night weekend trip to San Diego whilst holidaying in Los Angeles. We found the hotel to beclean, well-appointed and only a 10-15 minute drive to all attractions (we came mostly to visit the zoo). Staff well-mannered and helpful. The hotel had pleasant grounds - plenty of greenery, which is nice for a hotel on the outskirts of a city. Close to plenty of restaurants - always found somewhere good to eat. Overall good value for money and adequate for a weekend stay/stopover to see San Diego. Would stay again in future.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: levypark
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The accommodations were terrific and we had a pleasant stay. The pool and spa were additional bonuses. We loved the courtyard and layout of the hotel. Centrally located to everything. Breakfast was decent, but would have preferred better quality juices. Would stay there again anytime!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL.”
Reviews.Author: HAPPYTRAVELER011_11
Reviews.Content: My room had alot of closet space,also came with a microwave and fridge,,and the kids liked the heated pool an spa..also it was all gated in very safe an secure..Also proved a very nice continental breakfast bar. Not far from seaworld and the beach

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: tinga42758
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the California Suites Hotel in March 2011. Our family is very well traveled and I donâ€™t think we are too critical of the hotels in which we stay. But, we will not stay at the California Suites Hotel again. Customer Service: When we checked in we were met by two young adult staff members who were clearly more interested in continuing their conversation about their â€˜arduousâ€™ working conditions than actually greeting and checking in guests. After listening to their conversation for 3 to 5 minutes, I had to interject â€œcould we just focus on checking my family into the hotelâ€�. Of course my request was met with rolled eyes and contempt. But at least they started to focus. I had an older staff member during checkout but he never looked up from the computer - never looked at me â€“ not once. Just grabbed and slammed credit cards, receipts and pens onto the counter. No: Have a nice day, thanks for staying with us, please come again etc. wow. Continental almost breakfast: You have 3 bulk cereal choices â€“ flakes, raisin bran thing and â€˜cheeriosâ€™. Drinks Choices: Milk, Orange Juice, Cranberry Juice, Coffee/Decaf, 2 flavored coffees are all available Sometimes! Usually, except for milk, at least 3 of the above were out of stock so you really only have 2 to 3 choices. Pastries: None Mini muffins were available when the staff member decided to restock the basket. Breads: Just bagels sometimes but we had white bread available everyday. The staff member just stands behind her tip jar watching people not really stocking or cleaning. In fact, a mini muffin was left on a dining table over night and was still there the next morning when we returned. Fruit: 1st day Bananas, 2nd day Oranges 3rd day Oranges. We had to ask the staff to fill the fruit basket 2 out of three days. Accommodations: Think OLD None Branded Hotel. Not disgusting but dingy. AC Unit had the direction fins completely broken out and removed â€“ yes just a large Gapping hole blowing air. Light and electrical (AC) work like some weird combination of light switches and knobs. 1st to turn on kitchen light, flip light near TV 10 feet away then walk into kitchen and flip that knob etc. Rooms are suppose to be no smoking â€“ we had to sign stuff and pink swear not to smoke in the rooms but are room reeked of when we first entered. You see this â€˜Hotelâ€™ also doubles as a long term kind of cheap apartment for locals. Visitors come at all hours of the night â€“ smoke just outside the rooms and this smoke gets into the rooms. If you donâ€™t care much about customer service, breakfast or smoky rooms and are just going on price and location then this is the hotel for you. If you want to feel safe and secure in a clean environment then find a different Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value for decent accomodations”
Reviews.Author: peetieswie
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised at how well-maintained this facility was kept. I was in La Jolla for surgery at UCSD Thornton campus and needed a long-term stay that would not break the bank. My husband and I found this little gem on the internet and being from another state had no idea what to expect. The rooms are all very clean, the beds are very comfortable with fluffy pillows and clean-smelling bedding. Very basic accomodations, with simple amenities. The little kitchenette is a nice bonus for those of us on a budget, but there are no cooking utensils nor dishes to use. Not fancy or elaborate, just a great place to lay your head at night, get cleaned up and go explore San Diego. The continental breakfast is VERY basic, not fancy, but nice to be available. Highly recommend this place to anyone. The pools are very nice too. Garden is pretty.

Reviews.Title: “I haved stayed here before and will come back”
Reviews.Author: kenburg399
Reviews.Content: I have been here before about a year ago and came back again because the price was right and the people were friendly. This hotel is clean and fits my budget it is also convenient to the freeway so I can be downtown or a beach in 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good "family" place”
Reviews.Author: mmandymoe
Reviews.Content: this motel rents by the night, week, or month and yes, people, lots of people live at this motel. They are not nice and are always lingering outside smoking. I was worried about the kids the whole time. This is a motel that used to be a apartment complex. The rooms are far from traditional motel rooms. Very low quality soap and packets of shampoo. The "free buffet breakfast" is the same thing...everyday!!! cereal, coffee, juice, bagel, toast, and maybe fruit if you're lucky. I stayed for 6 days and it was the same thing time after time. Pool was stained with algae or something. The people "living" here are rude and just look less than trustworthy. The price is good, but really not a family place as far a safety is concerned. The wi-fi is not free, it is $6.95 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and good location”
Reviews.Author: che777
Reviews.Content: No nonesense motel which provides truly great value with clean well fitted rooms in a good location, just.off the freeway Staff friendly and helpful. .Area is fine and safe with convenience stores and food outlets Would definitely stay again. .

Reviews.Title: “great stay at California Suites Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jija76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at California Suites Hotel for 9 nights. We are very pleased about our stay there. The room was very clean and at night it was quiet! They have also a friendly staff and a large parking area. I Can recommand to anyone. We will come back someday. Au revoir et beaucoup de succes:-)

Reviews.Title: “No complaints!”
Reviews.Author: abysse
Reviews.Content: We were there for Comic-Con 2010 and this hotel exceeded our expectations! Even though the hotel street was noisy, we wouldn't hear a thing since we were on the back. The motel was clean, we loved the room, service, the free breakfeast (basic but appreciated). My only little complaint is that we could't get free wifi in our room. The total price of $265 for 4 nights (standard one queen room) was simply awesome! Haven't had the chance to try the pool! We had the car so it was not to far from downtown and the airport. If i go back to San Diego i will look nowhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and convient location”
Reviews.Author: dave_moore1947
Reviews.Content: Our stay in San DIego was enhanced by our accommodations. The California Suites Hotel is conviently located near a freeway enterance. The room was clean and well maintained. It was also very quiet despite the close proximity to the freeway, with all rooms opening onto a beautifully maintained and landscaped courtyard. It offered all of the amenities that we look for when away from home. We had a refigerator, microwave, an iron & ironing board and on site laundry facilities. It also had a mini kitchen with a two burner stove. There is ample free parking and access to the central courtyard is through locked gates. The staff was curtious, well informed and friendly. The continental breakfast that was incuded in the room rate provided fresh hot coffee, fruit juices and a good variety of fresh fruit, breads, cereals and pastries. My only complaint would be that there is no coffee available on site after the breakfast closes down at 9:00 AM.

Reviews.Title: “More than exceptional for the price”
Reviews.Author: AZJen
Reviews.Content: We were specifically looking for a hotel with easy access to San Diego, with good reviews, and which provided a microwave and refrigerator, all for a reasonable rate. We found all of this and more in the California Suites Hotel! Our exceptional service started the day before our stay. I called in advance and asked for an upstairs room because I am a light sleeper. The woman who took my call (I believe she was the manager), said "oh, I'll make sure I find you a very quiet room. I'm going to re-read your request to myself today and again tomorrow so I don't forget." She did not disappoint. We did not arrive until midnight, and I was concerned that maybe we'd be assigned some crummy, leftover room, but she had reserved one specifically for us, in an out-of-the-way corner of the hotel, away from stairways and parking, and with little foot traffic. Our room was PERFECTLY quiet. We slept completely undisturbed and were so grateful for her consideration. I called the front desk the next day to ask a question and the same woman answered. She remembered me and asked if our room was quiet enough for us. Her attention to detail was impressive. The room itself was just darling. It was quite literally, one of the cleanest hotel rooms I've ever stayed in. The bathroom fixtures were SPARKLING. The linens were clean. The grout on the floor in the bathroom was clean. We didn't see dust or cobwebs, even in the out-of-the-way nooks and crannies. The fridge and microwave were both clean. The carpet was clean. I even felt comfortable enough to walk bare-footed in the room, which I never do in a hotel. I noticed the same cleanliness around the hotel grounds. Every day I observed maintenance personnel cleaning the pool furniture, the pool deck, the trashcans, the railings, spills on the sidewalk, and various other high-traffic and/or high-dirt areas. The pool and jacuzzi were both sparkling clean and maintained at pleasant temperatures. The room was very comfortable. The beds were comfortable, the carpet was plush, the water pressure in the shower was nice, the walls were thick (we only heard our neighbors when our window was open), there was ample lighting, ample closet space, and room to move around. The decor and fixtures were definitely outdated, but were clean and in good repair. The television worked and offered a nice selection of channels. Internet is not free, but can be purchased. We chose not to purchase it so we cannot comment on its performance. Parking is free and relatively easy to come by, and our vehicle was safe. The staff is just wonderful. Several times we had a question about how to get somewhere or where to eat, and they were always helpful and friendly, and when they didn't know the answer to our question, they were honest in telling us they did not know, instead of sending us on a wild goose chase. The surrounding area is older, but safe and clean. To the west of the hotel lies a gas station and lower-end apartments. Across the street is a small shopping center with little restaurants and shops. A similar shopping center lies to the east of the property. Behind the property is a high school and a residential neighborhood. The hotel is located very close to the 805 freeway, but not so close that your stay is impacted by traffic and freeway noise. A couple of times we walked to neighboring businesses, and never felt unsafe, including after dark. We had a few complaints, but they were minor. Two of our four days, we did not have hot water in the shower. Apparently, they developed some sort of problem with the boiler while we were there. But both days, when we called maintenance, the problem was addressed immediately, to the best of their ability, and cheerfully. The breakfast is really pretty poor. It's nothing like the photo on their website. It consists of a juice machine with a few choices of juice, milk and 4 kinds of cereal, coffee and tea, white bread for toast, white bread bagels, peanut butter, jam and cream cheese for spreads, and a tiny amount of fruit. I think it could be rounded out nutritionally for about the same cost they spend on ingredients now. My biggest complaint is that the common areas are smoking areas. It was difficult at times to enjoy being in the pool area or even to have our windows open because there were so many smokers on site and they are permitted to smoke anywhere except in the actual rooms. It would be nice if there were designated smoking areas, and the main common-entertainment areas were kept smoke-free. We can't imagine ever staying in another San Diego hotel again. This hotel really has everything--comfort, affordability, service, cleanliness and accessibility.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: midnighter67
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and affordable. The courtyard is as pretty as the pictures on their website. It's in a quiet, safe neighborhood and is within 15 minutes of the zoo, Sea World, and multiple beaches. The ladies in the office are friendly but somewhat inefficient. My only gripes are you can't flush the toilet more than once every half hour because the tank takes so long to fill, the shower head is only about 5 feet above the bottom of the tub, and the room had a musty smell. The internet is $6.95/night and it's not wireless. The breakfast is coffee, juice, bagels, and cereal. Fortunately, we got a room that didn't face the pool. We walked by the pool several times in the evening and there was always a group of people and they were usually loud enough to disturb sleep. I would recommend this hotel if you're on a budget but make sure you request a room away from the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely facility; will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: 0709Nanna
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at the California Suites Hotel for our San Diego vacation this year. We were 4 adults with one child visiting family in the area. The cleaning service was wonderful, and the gardeners kept the facility well groomed and picture perfect! Each day my nephew, aged 9 went swimming in the beautiful pool. It was the highlight of his trip! The staff kept the pool and pool area very clean. Overall, I'd say the cleanliness of the place, along with the continental breakfast every morning, was what impressed us the most. I would recommend this place to anyone wanting to visit San Diego; it is close to everything!

Reviews.Title: “better value can be found elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: frugs33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. It is just off a busy road and is a large motel with many different buildings. We arrived late at night and there were several men loitering around the grounds. The motel seems more designed for long term residents than for tourists. Our room was okay but had a lot of wasted space, which I assume is storage space or just bad design. The pond in the courtyard is dyed an artificial blue chemical colour, which we didn't find attractive. The breakfast is muffins/danish with cold cereals. In the morning the towel rod fell off in the bathroom and no one was available to fix it. The website makes the hotel and grounds look nicer than it is. During this trip we also stayed at the Lafayette which although it has lots of negative reviews, was nicer and closer to downtown for about the same price. I think with a bit of research you can find something better than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not realy suites,but excellant value”
Reviews.Author: jc854
Reviews.Content: my family and i stayed for four nights on our vacation.the room was pretty small but we managed to make it work.the landscaping was perfect, rooms were very clean.kids liked the pool.no noise complaints.overall excellant value for the price

Reviews.Title: “Bring Perfume”
Reviews.Author: miztinam
Reviews.Content: I just recently relocated to San Diego and decided to stay at this hotel until I find an apartment. I ended up in a room that smelled like a musty, stuffy locker room (must be the old carpet). The first room I checked out was even stinkier and I caught the janitor coming out of the room with a can of odor eliminator. Though it's a hotel, there's no toaster, coffeemaker, alarm clock or iron/ironing board. The walls are very thin so be prepared to hear the conversations and snores of neighbors. The Internet is $7 a day but there is free internet in the lobby. The staff will not tell you unless you ask of course. There's also a "time limit" for using the wifi in the lobby. The pictures do not lie. The grounds are beautiful and serene looking. I just wish housekeeping spent more time on the rooms than they do on the upkeep of the courtyard. I decided not to extend my stay. There are so many hotels in San Diego that have better smelling rooms and more helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff.”
Reviews.Author: ex-Californian
Reviews.Content: This was a comfortable stay, with staff who went out of their way to help. Plenty of breakfast, large breakfast room, convenient to freeway, clean. Nice landscaping, nice pool area. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Best value and Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: Sophie104
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights while visiting family. The room was very clean and had a fridge, microwave and very small TV. Spotless painted walls, clean bathroom, nice grounds. I like that the rooms and doors face in to the courtyard. Nice neighborhood, next to a high school and eateries nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant!!!”
Reviews.Author: jrhey54vegas
Reviews.Content: Very, very pleasant grounds, very clean, near a convenience store/gas station - almost right out the door. Value is amazing - rooms were so reasonable my sister and I each got our own. The grounds have the most beautiful flowers and bushes. Best for one person to a room - no privacy while dressing. Folks in the office gave great service and were very helpful. Even the security guard gave good service. We could tell he kept an eye on us to be sure we were safe. The "gates" had made me wonder if there was a safety concern, but there really isn't. I think it's a case of proactive rather than reactive. Continental breakfast was fine - and swimming pool was pleasant. That's the best word - everything was pleasant. Amazing amount of storage room in the closets - would be very helpful for a long-term traveler. Mini fridge, micro, kitchen storage all very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite home away from home...it's awesome”
Reviews.Author: rslane32
Reviews.Content: This is a great little place to stay when in san diego. it's not downtown but it's centrally located and you can be on any major freeway in san diego in just a few minutes via the 52 just a couple block north. most of the rooms have a little cook top stove for heating things up and they all have a little fridge and microwave for your use. I really appreciate that functionality. The gardens are nice and the rooms are layed out along winding path through an inner courtyard. They have a nice well maintained pool that the heat year round and a big hot tub . The staff has the attitude of a team working to make this a special place and that is another thing sets it apart form your typical giant chain hotel. It doesn't look like much form the outside but when you enter the courtyard it feels really cozy and nice. I love the California suites and when friends and family come to visit me they always stay there. the rooms are simple clean and well maintained. they have a great free continental breakfast in the morning with juice and cereal fruit and pastries.Bets of all, the rates are very reasonable with great discounts if you are staying more than one night. I highly recommend staying there if you spend some time in san diego.

Reviews.Title: “NICE!!!”
Reviews.Author: ALTAIR2
Reviews.Content: This place was good. If your looking for an inexpensive place to stay this is it! There is breakfast every morning; it may not be eggs and bacon, but its good stuff. Nothing to complain about. Lates!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: allen50
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week on there weekly price which was a very good deal considering San Diego. The breakfast was not hot but more than enough selection with cereals ect. The staff was friendly and helpful and the rooms were a bit small but clean. The location was very convenient not to far to downtown or the beach. This is a no frills hotel but we were comfortable. We will come back

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good as is, even better considering the price”
Reviews.Author: ranshe
Reviews.Content: I commute to San Diego on a weekly basis. I need my hotel to be cheap (dirt cheap if possible), clean and comfortable, to include breakfast, and have easy access to my office. California Suites Hotel has provided me with all of that. The bonus is what seems to be (I didn't have the time to try) a nice pool / spa (no gym, though). Downside is they charge for internet (but I do have my data card...). Breakfast is fine OK - nothing fancy, but again, you can't expect anything fancy with their price tag. Good access to both I805 and I5 highways. Good deal if you're on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoVisitor
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on several occasions with my family and we return each year. It's conveniently located, the staff are very knowledgeable about the area and they guided us in a budget conscious manner, with respect to which places to visit, best times of day to go there, which coupons could be used to reduce costs etc. The gardens and the outdoor heated pool area are very relaxing and nicely maintained. When looking at some of the reviews in Trip Advisor, I was quite astonished to learn that one does not even have to be at a particular hotel to write a review on it! This explains a number of quite ridiculous and defamatory comments that are sometimes made by people who have no connection with the hotel whatsoever or may have been asked to leave the premises due to inappropriate behaviour and then in an act of revenge, post damaging reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting property and very rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Onthegonow77
Reviews.Content: We do not suggest anyone staying at this pit. The hotel and area surrounding the hotel are in very poor shape. The staff needs some training in polite manners too. Please find another hotel to stay at - this one is really gross & dangerous.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: KandSFamily
Reviews.Content: July our family was able to enjoy San Diego for one night. The staff were very friendly and informative. The room was 2 beds with a kitchenette. This was nice to have some fridge room and counter space. No dishes how ever. The motel had a nice clean pool and hot tub. The grounds were well taken care of and tidy. Pretty fountain with blue colored water. The room was average priced for the area at $130 for one night. Hotel was only approx. 10 minutes from Sea World and the major beaches. Nice continental breakfast with plenty to eat and continuously replenished in the morning. In all a good family stay.

Reviews.Title: “Yuk - do not stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: greattimetotravel
Reviews.Content: The grounds and rooms are very dirty. The area that is it located is not the greatest either. There seems to be quite a bit of crime around the hotel. We don't recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your possessions!”
Reviews.Author: solomon98
Reviews.Content: I'll agree with most others reviewing California Suites. It is very reasonably priced compared to most other hotels in the San Diego area. However, there is definitely a creepy feel to the place. Way too many locked gates seperarating you from the outside (not a good indicator of the neighborhood). The room was definitely dated and on a very hot day the window air unit was trying hard to keep the room cool. The worst part of this stay was the mishap I had at the hotel's pool. I left my towel and my sandals by one of the pool chairs while I took a swim. When I got out of the water my towel was there, but my sandals were gone (in 4 minutes flat...quick robbery). There are residents that stay at the hotel for more than months at a time for all I can tell, and I'm sure one of them needed a sandal upgrade. Enjoy your stay with one eye open.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Cate13
Reviews.Content: This hotel was such a good deal that I set my expectations quite low and was pleasantly surprised. The hotel staff were wonderful and genuinely concerned for the comfort and security of their guests. The rooms are not the best part of this hotel...average in size, with a small bathroom, two double (not queen) beds that were not superior in quality but adequate. There was an iron&board, hairdryer, little kitchenette (except the bathroom was so small this was also your changing area), microwave and mini fridge. The only real complaint I had about the room was that they seem to spray it with a perfumed carpet spray or something. However...the good stuff...great pool and hot tub that are open until 10 pm, and cleaned every morning, a convenient and clean onsite laundrymate, a great little breakfast with cereal, bagels, toast, pastries, juice and coffee, free parking that is well lit and has security monitors, close proximity to just about everythinig in San Diego, with a starbucks, grocery store, several small restaurants, gas station all in walking distance. They charge by the room, not the person...we had four adults sharing a room and we were quite comfortable. The grounds of this hotel are attractive and immaculately kept. I would recommend this hotel for families, couples, elderly (ask for a main floor room as there are no elevators to second level), mature singles. Not the hotel for the partiers or large groups of singles.

Reviews.Title: “Just Don't”
Reviews.Author: hickmangirl
Reviews.Content: Other reviewers must have extremely low expectations. First off, my reservation would have been terminated at 10pm if I hadn't phoned from the airport saying our flight was delayed and we'd only be landing in SAN at midnight. Secondly, after telling them we wouldn't have the rental car we'd booked, they said there were no airport shuttles and we were on our own for finding transportation to the hotel. If it hadn't been after midnight I wouldn't have been bothered by this but considering the time, I was very bothered and almost upset. SO, we caught the Cloud 9 shuttle (excellent service, great price) out to Clairemont Mesa. Upon arrival to the hotel, the lobby is shut it's got that spooky B film lighting going on in the "atrium" and I'm just waiting for some Jason Myers character to pop out of the bird of paradise behind me. THEN, we were given 2 keys and sent on our merry way...without being able to walk through the lobby to get to the pond where our room was. So, through the blue door and into a corridor....which way should we go? No signage but fortunately I heard outdoor noises and followed till we came out onto a pathway...still no idea where I'm going. We were given a map of the property but at night you can't necessarily see where the paths are going. Our room was right behind the pond and as soon as I looked at the door I wanted to run back and catch the shuttle. No modern lock....it was a lock in the doorhandle with a regular domestic deadbolt above. Opening the door, you see a huge tv (nice) and some shabby indoor/outdoor carpeting. Also, a window AC unit mounted into the wall--which never cooled the room, just blew around stale warm air all night. The bathroom could do with modernizing and the stovetop that's in the room looks like it just woke up in the 70s. Preparing for bed, crawling under the sheets, I just felt like the sheets weren't as clean as they should be. Also, there were only 2 pillows which was a downfall since my boyfriend likes to sleep with 2 pillows under his head. Also, a thing to note is that they offer weekly rates....which, in my experience tells you a lot about the caliber of hotel. All in all, if you just need somewhere to hang your hat for the night, and you've got a car, and want to spend less than 65 bucks it's great. Otherwise, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good and clean rooms, friendly staff, nice setting - highly recomended”
Reviews.Author: miknas
Reviews.Content: Had awesome time in San Diego and California Suites Hotel was definitely a good choice. Great value for your money, have absolutely no complaints. The room was spacious with a kitchen unit and bathroom. We had room service everyday, the hotel provides fresh towels and other usual bits like soap etc. Staff was helpful and very nice. Hotel provides inclusive breakfast which was not bad. The location is also decent, about 15-20 mins from downtown. Would definitely come back and recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect....”
Reviews.Author: PhilippeP
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpfull staff. Nice and cosy place. Great price.(except maybe for the Internet wich is a 6.95/d supplement, I didi enjoy the pool and spa instead!) Would certainly return and recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place Great Price”
Reviews.Author: calibeauty2die4
Reviews.Content: Very nice clean place. Clean rooms. Great Price! I really liked it my one problem was that we stayed across from the pool so at night when we were trying to rest all you can hear is "marco polo" and in the middle of the night it sounded like a herd of cows were above us. But othere than that it was a nice stay

Reviews.Title: “San Diego hidden treasure”
Reviews.Author: GodandCountry
Reviews.Content: Two night stay on April 8th and 9th to catch a few Padres games. Hotel is clean with very resonable rates that won't hurt anyones budget. Every room faces inward to a well landscape garden oasis which makes for the perfect sound barrier to keep things quite in the evening. Easy 10 minute drive to downtown or any other attractions one would enjoy to visit. Free breakfast of mostly carbs and juices, but what the hey its" free". Best deal in San Diego

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: swmvgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a super find. I stayed for a week in late March and could not have been happier. Everything was very clean and well maintained, the staff was nice, it was fairly quiet, and it was a great value. A very modest breakfast is included (bagels, cereal and fruit). It is very family friendly - not a party spot. There is a security guard on staff at night and the pool is open until 10pm. (If you go to bed early ask for a room on the other side of the property.) It is located close to the 805 freeway which makes it easy to get everywhere from the hotel. There are a few restaurants within walking distance and an AMPM next door. GREAT motel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the money”
Reviews.Author: fradertoadie
Reviews.Content: The price could not be beat! We Stayed 4 nights for around $186.00. Housekeeping was great. They came in and tidied our room up everyday. The staff was friendly. The pool was heated and well maintained and the hot tub was really nice. Also, it was in a great location and close to many attractions. The only complaint I had was that the beds were not firm enough. That wouldn't be a problem for someone with a really good back. Also, the breakfast left much to be desired. Most of the time the only thing left was toast and on a good day a few bagels and donuts and cereal. There was also only one toaster and there was always a big line for it. But overall it was a nice stay and we would probably stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: kdeely
Reviews.Content: Booked a 4 night stay following reviews on Trip Advisor & was not disappointed. Rooms are basic but are clean & comfortable. Nicely landscaped property with good security. Don't be put off by the exterior appearance. Pool and jacuzzi in common area are clean and well maintained. Very reasonable rates with a nice continental breakfast included (fruit, cereal, juice, coffee, bagels, pastries). Close to everything - located on main road short distance from freeway. Close to restaurants and shopping. NOT for a romantic getaway, but great for family on a budget. Housekeeping was excellent. Hotel is older, but management clearly cares about appearances and has maintained the property well.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive and nicely priced. Would Stay again!”
Reviews.Author: PDX-FamilyTraveler
Reviews.Content: I took my family to San Diego for a vacation and we ended up at this hotel after doing considerable research online. The price was excellent and the reviews generally good. I was not disappointed. We have 2 adults and 2 kids, aged 5 and 8. I searched/shopped for a hotel online and then called the hotel directly because the room descriptions online weren't clear if we were getting double beds. Yes, the 2 bedroom room is 2 double, not queen beds. They matched the online prices (~$60) no problem. The entryway is very cute, but the main lobby is uninteresting. Don't be discouraged. The rest of the outside interior areas of this hotel are very nicely landscaped. Very attractive and well-maintained. The room had lots of storage for our stuff, and a decent sized kitchenette (we only had a microwave, but some rooms had a couple of burners. No coffee maker in the rooms but the continental breakfast was pretty good and starts at 6:30. The beds we had in our room were not too comfortable, but I confirmed that they are in the process of updating mattresses in the guest rooms (pillow top!). Our pillows were really flimsy - so ask for a couple extra. Heat and air both worked fine. Didn't try the internet, because I had good cell phone/3G coverage within the hotel. There are quite a few people essentially living here, but everyone we ran into was very friendly. We were here over the New-Years holiday and there was a bunch of noise from the room next door from 3-4pm, and I called the lobby, and they took care of it very quickly. The hotel is very conveniently located close to the freeway. - 15 minutes to Sea World or the San Diego Zoo. - 35 minutes to the Wild Animal Park. - 15 minutes to the coast. - 25 minutes to the airport. Although it is close to the I-805 freeway, and we were on the outside closest to the freeway, freeway noise didn't bother us from within our room. The outdoor heated pool, hot-tub, and patio furniture are attended too every morning. The shallow end of the pool has a wide stairs and the pool itself goes from 3 feet to 8 feet deep. Pool is open until 10pm. I would definitely stay here again if/when I go back to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great no-frills accommodations”
Reviews.Author: HomeawayfromhomeAZ
Reviews.Content: California Suites Hotel offers clean, no-frills lodging and friendly service. The complementary continental breakfast is more than enough to get you off to a good start, the grounds are beautifully maintained with a tropical feeling and the prices are unbeatable by San Diego standards. Located in the Clairemont area, it's approximately a 10-minute drive to Balboa Park and less than 15 minutes to the beach. Next door at the strip mall is a fabulous vegetarian restaurant and across the street is a tasty yogurt shop.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful! Loved staying here!”
Reviews.Author: gemini_baby0608
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel! From the outside it doesnt look like much, but once you get inside the hotel gates, it's really pretty! Fountain, Pool, Hot Tub, nice greenery. Came to San Diego to visit family in Clariemont, and this hotel was in a convenient location and for a great price. Pros: 1.) Great Continental Breakfast (bagels, cereal, toast, bananas, oranges, french vanillas, muffins) and a nice room to eat it in. 2.) Lots of TV channels - I think the channels went up to 80 or something! Way above avg hotels! 3.) Clean and spacious rooms (can fit a rollaway bed too) - bathroom was nice, nice sized closets 4.) Nice fridge, little stove (not pots though), microwave, (has all the things you need) 5.) Super-Friendly staff, and great informational guide-booklet about the hotel and nearby restaurants in the room. 6.) Excellent price for a hotel in California! 7.) Very Serene - fountain, pool, hottub, trimmed greenery Cons: 1.) Our request for a rollaway bed came at 9:30 pm (which is okay because who really sleeps that early anyway) 2.) No elevator - but there's only 2 floors anyway. We really enjoyed our stay, and we'll be sure to stay here again if we visit San Diego California again.

Reviews.Title: “Budget accomodations with some additional amenities”
Reviews.Author: BZT
Reviews.Content: If you navigate the California Suites website, you conjure up a view of the lushly landscaped grounds, full of tropical flora, a sunny Mediterranean outdoor decor, a sparkling swimming pool, and clean, immaculate accomodations. Lounging in the pool doing an elementary backstroke, you'd get the same viewpoint . Notice I've mentioned "basic accomodations". Indeed the website and your pool view show part of the story. Jarringly, as you drive up on Clairemont Mesa Blvd, in the middle of commercial plazaa and surrounded by a type of faded suburb so common near California urban centers, you do see a nondescript parking lot, below apartment car ports which does not seem consistent with your expectations. You'll notice security cameras everywhere, old fashioned lock barriers to all entrances, and finally a diminutive lobby. Though our rooms are immacuately maintained, signs of deferred maintenance such as tools/cleaning materials situated round the property, plastic bins to catch room A/C condensate, and even the old fashioned keys with the room # prominently ID'd (only missing the medallion "place in any mailbox return postage guaranteed") were a bit, as I say, offputting. So get the idea that this hotel gives basic accomodations, has a rather disorienting entrance and initial impression. The sounds of traffic hurtling down Clairemont Mesa Blvd is filtered over by bubbling fountain pools and room A/C units. Rooms themselves have been made over with our two bed units including newly installed well cleaned rugs, a small kitchenette with microwave, coffee maker and refrigerator, plus a sink doubling as a bathroom washbasin. There is a significant charge for Internet access (we didn't try) plus substantial penalty fees for smoking in the rooms and for taking the rather standard style of hotel towels. i would say that this addresses the cllientele of the hotel rather than being any distinctive management policy. Long term stays are encouraged as this would be a reasonable place to stay while enjoying the San Diego lifestyle, though not on the beach it is but 20 minutes from the San Diego/Del Mar beaches. But recall you are getting in many cases sub $100/night lodgings in an ordinary area of the extraordinary city of San Diego. Trip Advisor users who keep this in mind will get some idea how suitable this is for their stay.

Reviews.Title: “An unpleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: qwfqwf
Reviews.Content: I was traveling on a budget and I had a good deal for a twoâ€“day stay. The front desk was unhelpful and definitely not friendly at all. I asked for directions and for some restaurant suggestions, and the answers were "sorry, I don't have dinner out very often, so I can't recommend any restaurant in the area ". I asked to borrow a staple for 5 minutes but I could only use it in the lobby. At early morning or late night the lobby access is closed and if you need something you have to walk out from the hotel using the parking lot access and re-enter the lobby from the front (waste of time and also potentially dangerous at night). I booked a room with an extra-bed, the extra bed was not there at our arrival. The room was extra-hot and we had to keep the old and loud a/c unit constantly on. In sum, I don't complain too much for the price, but I won't suggest this stay to anyone with decent expectation in terms of customer service and politeness.

Reviews.Title: “PICTURES WERE DECEIVING”
Reviews.Author: sanluis10
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel thinking i was getting a good deal. I had also booked it months in advanced. When i spoke to them on the phone we had come to the agreement that i would be staying next to my families room. When I got there it was a different story!! My hotel was not close to theres. When I walked in the room It stunk like smoke (even though it was a No smoking room). The bathroom was durty!! Not clean enough for my little boy to take a shower in!!! And worst of all the continental breakfast wasent much of a breakfast. Motel 8 has it better and you pay less!!! I will never go back there again!! The pictures online make this hotel look really good and when I got there I was decipointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay at California Suites”
Reviews.Author: TravelingVisitor
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks very plain on the outside, (facing the boulevard) but once inside you are greeted by winding paths through well planted gardens with palm trees, flowers, a fountain and bougainvillea winding over the arches. There are benches here and there where you can enjoy the pretty setting. Every member of the staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms have a little kitchenette with a small fridge, and 2 burner stove. There is a free breakfast buffet, in a large room with tables, a few soft easy chairs, books and a tv. This is not a luxury hotel but it is charming, reasonable, clean and pleasant. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, with not so good customer service @ Check in Desk”
Reviews.Author: w0rkingtraveler
Reviews.Content: Rooms are plain but clean and a faily good value for the money, But the customer service at the check in counter was a little strange. I travel for work and picked this hotel due to cost and location. Both were good but the experience I had upon check in was almost rude in nature. It was a little late when I arrived as it is most of the places I go but, I felt as if they didn't want me to stay with them. I was tempted to go accross the street to one of the two hotels over there. It was late, I was tired and I stayed anyway. The rest of my stay was fine and no real problems to report. It did seem that they had some residents that lived there full time. I thought that was odd, but they did not present any problems. I am not sure how they are a three star hotel! I would say two stars.

Reviews.Title: “A good deal”
Reviews.Author: am-ls
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights at the California Suites Hotel in San Diego in September 2007. Neighborhood The hotel is situated right off a freeway, but it is in a quiet neighborhood. A few blocks away there's a mall with many shops. There were a lot of parking spots available, I parked in the back, but the entire car park was fenced in, so it was safe to park there. It's pretty far from the beach or the city centre, but with a car, I found it didn't take too long to find a nice place to sightsee or have a nice meal. Room The rooms are simple and clean enough. This is modest standard, but given the price, the room was decent. The bed was comfortable and big. The walls are thin, so if you are a light sleeper, and especially if you need to sleep late, have some earplugs handy. Bathroom The bathroom was small, with a toilet and a tub. It was clean, which is the most important to me. Service I didn't really ask for anything from the staff, so I can't say too much about the service. They cleaned the room when I was out, which is most important to me. The persons I met at the reception desk were friendly and smiling when I checked in and out. Short summary As you would probably guess from the price, this isn't a hotel, but a motel, The rooms aren't suites, but they're big. But this is a nice motel that meets the requirements of most people looking for a cheap place to stay in San Diego. As such this is a place I can recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for the Money Spent”
Reviews.Author: cody3Texas
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel and felt it was very good value. The staff was friendly, the rooms were a bit small but very clean. and I loved the gardens. The pool was a ggod size and the laundry room was a nice plus. I recommend this hotel for anybody looking for decent hotel at an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: regina560
Reviews.Content: I saw the hotel online and thought it looked OK for the price. I was pleasantly surprised that it was very clean and centrally located. It is close enough to the beach and to the downtown area. I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended! Terrible experience!”
Reviews.Author: srund
Reviews.Content: Rude, unfriendly staff with an attitude, rooms with walls so thin the people in the next room sound like they're sitting on the bed next to you, uncomfortable beds and to top it all off, the hotel wouldn't honor their own cancellation policy and give me a refund. For those who want to know why I say this, here's the details of my experience with this hotel and it's staff: I booked a couple non-smoking rooms for 2 nights at this hotel. I get to my room and it stinks to high heaven of cigarette smoke. I call the desk and a very unfriendly woman answers and tells me there's no guarantees for room preferences when you book on-line. I say ok, are there any non-smoking rooms available? With quite the attitude she tells me there's no other rooms available at all. A moment later the man who checked us in called me back with my internet password - internet access costs an additional $7 per room. I tell him that I reserved a non-smoking room and ask him if there are any non-smoking rooms. He checks quickly and says yea no problem, we can put you in another room. By this time it's almost midnight when I get to the other room and the people in the next room are having a little party. I can hear them very clearly talking and laughing. I lay down in the bed - which was very uncomfortable - and close my eyes to see if I might be able to sleep through it but it only takes a moment to realize I'm not going to get any sleep with that racket so I go back to the front desk to ask them if they have any other non-smoking rooms available. The woman says she'll send security to tell the people in the other room to quiet down. Meanwhile, I go across the street to the Best Western to see if they have any rooms just in case. I get back, go to my room and of course I can still hear the people talking and laughing and by now, they've turned the radio on. I go to the front desk and ask her if security spoke with them and again with the attitude, she tells me they were just talking normally and there was no party going on. I say well if that's the case the walls in the rooms are paper thin and I want to cancel my reservations for the next night - the written policy I received from Hotels.com when I made this reservation said at this hotel, if you cancel less than 24 hours before your reservation you have to pay for one night - so I knew I would have to pay for 1 night for each of the two rooms. This rude woman tells me she can't do anything about canceling my reservation for the next night and says I have to call Hotels.com about it and she walks away from me. I call Hotels.com and they say they have to call the hotel to get the approval to cancel the next night. I tell the Hotels.com rep that they're not going to cancel the reservation because they want the money. Sure enough, the rep gets back to me and tells me that the hotel doesn't want to cancel the reservation. No kidding? What a surprise! I remind the rep of the cancellation policy they sent me, and fortunately the Hotels.com rep canceled my reservation for the 2nd night and said my I'd be getting the refund. I go back to the night window check-in desk at the hotel to give the room key back and to get the refund for the internet access that I pre-paid - 2 rooms for 2 nights, @ $7 per room, a total of $28 - but she would only refund $14 to me for my room not for the other room. I pre-paid my friend's internet access for his room for 2 nights. He was already in his room and I knew he wanted to use it that night, but she wouldn't refund the $7 for the next night even though I told her he wouldn't be staying there for the 2nd night. She said if he checks out the next day, my credit card will be refunded the $7 bucks - I just checked the card I used and as of now, all that's showing up is the $28 in charges and no refunds!! Oh and by the way, she was very happy to tell me that she would not be giving the refund to Hotels.com for my cancelation. I said well if that's how you want to do business with Hotels.com that's your right but at least you're not getting my money. After all this I felt like a mark who got suckered by a con artist. So in an attempt to get one small victory out of the situation, when a young guy walked up to the night window to get a room, I tried to dissuade him from staying there that night by telling him my story. When I got to the part about the people partying in the next room making all the noise he said "that's what I came here for, to party, so it sounds good to me". Then he checked in and got a room and I went to the Best Western across the street. So I guess that's this hotel's market - college aged kids who want to party and don't care about getting any sleep, let alone sleeping on a comfortable bed. But for business people or families - I beg you,...pay $10 bucks more a night and get a good room somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: babytut
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 3 nights at the hotel and was disappointed. The landscaping on the property was a lot nicer than the rooms. The rooms were musty and the bed (a queen) was very soft. Only two pillows were provided and they too smelled musty. The rooms have a fride but no in room coffee pot. This facility is a temporary living facility as well as a travel hotel. People were coming and going all through the night. In addition, they had out actual keys, instead of key cards, which seemed a little weird considering this day and age. The continental breakfast was also disappointing. No healthy items were provided. It consisted of almost all carbs, bread, cheap doughnuts and cereal and only 1 kind of milk was provided. In addition, signs are posted tht you cannot take food back to the rooms (what's that about?) The front desk staff was a little rough around the edges and not so helpful. I will not book at this facility again. The rooms were not so clean and the cliental at the facility were a little unsavory. I know there are better value rooms in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: HarveySilverSpring
Reviews.Content: After reading several of the negative reviews of this hotel, I was a little leery. However, the rate was so good during the time of a very large convention that had jacked up all SD hotel rates, I decided to give it a try. It is somewhat of a misnomer to call the rooms suites, they are standard size hotel rooms with a separate kitchen/bath area (no, the bathroom is not in the kitchen, but the sink is) with a divider, The bed was a little too firm and did not compare to upscale hotels, however it was acceptable and comparable to low to mid-range motel chains. The pool is very large and nice. The breakfast room is also large and there is a decent continental breakfast (selection of cereals, fruit, juice, bagels, bread, danish, coffee, tea, milk) and a toaster. Nothing outstanding, but certainly satisfying. The grounds are very nice for a motel and there is good security with the requirement that you use a key to open the gates. Parking was sufficient. The area is a little challenged. There are several adult book stores about a mile from the hotel, but that is quite a distance. For those concerned about stairs, be warned there is no elevator so it would be good to request a first floor room. All in all, I consider this to be a good value and I wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the trouble”
Reviews.Author: stephanieloner
Reviews.Content: This is a true motel! Like many other families staying her, we were suckered in by the price. This hotel was old and very uncomfortable. My kids did enjoy the pool and we meet some other nice families who had alos been suckered in by the price. But that is the only good thing I can say. There are many people living at this motel full time and it was very creepy. Please spend the extra cash to find yourself a nice clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great base for a San Diego trip”
Reviews.Author: tstl1
Reviews.Content: I'm really surprised at the negative comments about this hotel. No, it's not the Hilton. However, it only cost us $70/night. For the price it was a great place to use as a base for visiting Sea World and the San Diego Zoo. I think the name is misleading as our room was not a suite, but it did have a separate kitchen area. Still, the room was clean, appeared to be well kept, and clean. There were several reasonably priced, idependently owned (ie non-franchised) restaurants within walking distance. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Breakfast (cereal, oatmeal, bagels, donuts, toast, and fruit) was included. Our 6 year old loved the garden and fountain, the heated pool, and the hot tub. If you're ultra picky then go somewhere else. If you know a good value when you see it then this may be your place. If I were returning to San Diego I'd book another room here without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Get Sucked in”
Reviews.Author: vlc2dlc
Reviews.Content: Don't get sucked in by the pictures, this is NOT A HOTEL! The rooms are very small. Motel 6 has bigger rooms. I booked 2 months in advance, ( 1 bed, smoking, suite) but was told when we got there they did not have ANY smoking rooms available. So they gave us a Non-smoking, Non-suite room. When I reminded them I had booked 2 months in advance they replyed "sorry, nothing we can do about that, rooms are not guaranteed" I thought that was the point of booking in advance, right?? The room did have a small frig. and a smaller microwave and the TV was a 19", the bathroom was barely big enough for two people to stand in and the shower head is set at just over 5 ft. My husband is 6 ft. It was my husband and I's 20th anniversary and it started off terrible because of this place. Thank God the rest of our trip was wonderful. The only thing I can say nice about this "hotel" is that the room was clean. Very Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. For the price we payed we thought it would atleast be a little more nice. The hotel seemed old, so everthing looked dated except for the bathroom. It was a dissapointment to say the least. We even found baby misquitos in our room! We definatley will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed based on all the favorable reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Based on the numerous favorable reviews, I expected a lot more. The staff was pleasant and accomodating. We arrived two days early and they extended my reservation without an issue. Room was smaller than I expected, and the air conditioner was not on, and the windows were open. Usually not an issue, but San Diego was having a heat wave and it was in the 90's-and not much cooler in the room :-) We begged them daily to leave the a/c on, as it was stifling in the room when we came in, and it would take hours to cool off, making sleep difficult. Sheets were too small for the bed. As soon as we got into the bed, the fitted sheet snapped off and hit us in the face :-) Pillows were very small. We had no hot water for 2 days, making showering non-existent. We complained and got one night taken off. Breakfast was ridiculous. We got up early the first moring, to find no milk left for coffee, not fruit, 90% of the cereal was gone, few breads and fewer rolls-and it was only 8AM. We decided it wasn't worth waking up early on vacation for orange juice and nothing else. The pool was nice, but only 4 lounge chairs for the entire pool. If you didn't stake out a chair as soon as the pool opened, you were out of luck. No bathroom facillities at the pool-parents were forced to take their children back to the room, or let them go in the pool-which they did :-( Towels were very small, and they don't give you more than 2 in your room. I took some extra from the cart, after asking, and someone came along and basically accused me of stealing the towels. You'd think they were gold. On the plus side, the grounds are beautiful. The gardens were pleasant to wake up to. Location was great, I don't think it took more than 10 minutes to get to anywhere, other than Wild Animal Park, which is far to start with :-) All in all, not great, expected better, never had so many complaints, but I didn't let it screw up my vacation. I love San Diego.

HotelInfo.Name: California Suites Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 5415 Clairemont Mesa Boulevard, San Diego, CA 92117
